main event: On 20 March 1955, ground radar and air visuals confirmed the sighting of 16 unidentified flying objects over Tokyo, Japan.
interesting points: The radar detected 16 unidentified objects, but intercept results were negative., The objects were tracked at an average speed of 500 mph at an altitude of 25,000 feet., Visual confirmation of one object was made by multiple witnesses, including civilians and military personnel., A civilian observed a luminous white object approximately 200 yards in diameter moving at about 1,000 mph., The report documented concludes that the sightings remain unexplained.
